Description: A wide cotton sash (?), almost square in shape. The ground is divided into three main sections: a red centre field [twill woven, chevron patterning] framed by narrower red and yellow bands [twill woven, diamond patterning]. At each selvedge is a green stripe. The centre field contains three registers of silver-coloured columns and four large green and silver-coloured motifs, redolent of ikat patterning. All coloured yarns cotton with synthetic (?), with silver-coloured metal strip.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: Shelagh Weir (BM Ethnography Department staff)
